subject: Economics
title: Zero-Sum Games: Your Gain Is My Loss
description: Learn Zero-Sum Games: Your Gain Is My Loss in one minute.

hook.text: In poker, every dollar you win is a dollar someone else loses. Total winnings always equal total losses.

buildup.text: Zero-sum: the pie is fixed. More for me means less for you. Chess, tennis, and poker are zero-sum. Winners need losers.

discovery.text: Most of life is NOT zero-sum. Trade, cooperation, and innovation grow the pie. Both sides can win.

twist.text: Politicians often frame economics as zero-sum: immigrants take 'our' jobs, trade steals 'our' wealth.

climax.text: Mistaking positive-sum games for zero-sum ones leads to destructive competition.

punchline.text: The biggest mistake in strategy is treating a growing pie like a fixed one.

quiz.question: Why is it harmful to treat a positive-sum game as zero-sum?
options: It makes the game more fun
It leads to destructive competition instead of cooperation that could benefit all parties
